Teal: Interactive Exploratory Analysis Shiny Web-Applications

We are working on a next major version that we expect to release in mid 2019.

Please read more about teal on our agile-R website at go.roche.com/agile-R.

teal is a shiny-based interactive exploration framework for analyzing clinical trials data. teal currently provides a dynamic filtering facility and diverse data viewers. teal shiny applications are built using standard shiny modules.

Getting Started

  1. Install teal as described in the installation section below.

  2. Create a new file app.R, and paste this code into it:

    library(teal)

ASL <- generate_sample_data('ASL')
ARS <- generate_sample_data('ARS')
ATE <- generate_sample_data('ATE')

x <- teal::init(
  data =  list(ASL = ASL, ARS = ARS, ATE = ATE),
  modules = root_modules(
    module(
      "data source",
      server = function(input, output, session, datasets) {},
      ui = function(id) div(p("information about data source")),
      filters = NULL
    ),
    tm_data_table(),
    tm_variable_browser(),
    modules(
      label = "analysis items",
      tm_table(
        label = "demographic table",
        dataname = "ASL",
        xvar = "SEX",
        yvar = "RACE",
        yvar_choices = c("RACE", "AGEGR", "REGION")
      ),
      tm_scatterplot(
        label = "scatterplot",
        dataname = "ASL",
        xvar = "AGE",
        yvar = "BBMI",
        color_by = "_none_",
        color_by_choices = c("_none_", "STUDYID")
      ),
      module(
        label = "survival curves",
        server = function(input, output, session, datasets) {},
        ui = function(id) div(p("Kaplan Meier Curve")),
        filters = "ATE"
      )
    )
  ),
  header = tags$h1("Sample App"),
  footer = tags$p("Copyright 2017")
)

shinyApp(x$ui, x$server)
  3. Execute the above code to run the sample app.

  4. You can now modify this sample app to fit your needs. For example, delete ARS and ATE, and change ASL to your dataset, for example:

    ASL <- read_bce("/opt/BIOSTAT/qa/ts00010/libraries/asl.sas7bdat")
  5. Edit the modules in the modules = argument. For example, you can rearrange, delete, or add new modules

  6. Push this app to the shiny server (only you can access), with:

    ## setwd() to location of app.R
rocheBCE::shinypub("./", "users/your-unix-id/sample-app")

  7. For more info, run this vignette (paste into R console and run):

    vignette("01_getting_started", package = "teal")

Installation

Stable Release

While on the Roche network, open R or RStudio and execute the following:

# install.packages("devtools")
library(devtools)
install_github(
  'Rpackages/teal', ref = "v0.0.4",
  host = 'https://github.roche.com/api/v3',
  upgrade_dependencies = FALSE,
  build_vignettes = TRUE
)

Development Version

Please read the web-manual for the development version. To install the development version use

devtools::install_github(
  'Rpackages/teal', ref = "master",
  host = 'https://github.roche.com/api/v3',
  upgrade_dependencies = FALSE,
  build_vignettes = TRUE
)

More Teal Modules

Where there are quite a few teal modules in the wild, we are currently working on high-quality reusable teal modules which are available in the teal.tern package.

Documentation

Currently there are a number of resources with documentation:

  1. The agile-R website

  2. The project website

  3. The teal package vignettes run

    library(teal)
vignettes(package = "teal")

  4. The teal R manual pages

    help(package = "teal")
